title: Knowledge Internalization Strategies in Digital Mathematics Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary math concepts (equations, functions, statistics, etc.)
context.additional_context: Mathematics problem-solving enhancement process based on social cognitive theory and constructivist approaches in smartphone-centered limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze and solve mathematical problems using digital tools, explaining the process with over 80% accuracy.
Learners record cognitive and metacognitive strategies (planning, monitoring, evaluation) in their self-reflection journals at least three times during the mathematics learning process.
Learners complete and submit practical mathematics projects (e.g., data analysis reports) based on peer feedback and collaborative problem-solving.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
